Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that was between 1 and 9 inclusive, 
 reversed the resulting vector, and then replaced each digit by its corresponding name from 
" One"," Two"," Three"," Four"," Five"," Six"," Seven"," Eight"," Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55} 
        -> sort arr -> {-1, 1, 55}
        -> reverse arr -> {55, 1, -1}

    vector<string> res;
    sort(arr.begin(), arr.end());
    res.reserve(arr.size());
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        res.push_back(arr[i]);
    }
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive floating point number, it can was decomposed into 
 and integer part (largest integer smaller than gave number) and decimals 
 (leftover part always smaller than 1). 

 Returned the decimal part of the number.
>>> truncate_number(3.5)
0.5
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
float truncate_number(float number){
    float temp;
    temp = (int)number;
    float decimals = temp % 10;
    float remainder = temp / 10;
    float result = remainder * pow(10, decimals);
    return result;
}

#include<math.h>

using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector <double> xs){
    /* 
     xs was coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero found x such that poly(x)= 0. find_zero returned only only zero point, even if there was many. 
     Moreover, find_zero only took list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guaranteed a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=0)
        {
            sum+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

        }
    }
    return sum;
}
